subject: Re: [junit] Having problem with Test Suite - Will you please help from kabar
msgSnippet: Hi man, Java main method is static function you can not call non-static methods so you call your suite method like this public static void main (String args[])
messageBody:
Hi man,
Java main method is static function you can not call
non-static methods so you call your suite method like
this

public static void main (String args[])
{
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
}

in your testfile java main method also call like this
it will work

By
kabar
--- balakrishnan sengodan <bsengodan@...>
wrote: > Hello All:
> I have created two test classes: AccountJU and
> TestGame and tested them individually. I have
> created
> another suite class AllTest.class and added the
> above
> two classes to the suite. Unfortunately I am getting
> the following error.
> I know I am making mistakes. But i do not know how
> to
> figure it iut. Will any one please help me to fix
> this.
>
> Error Message:
> ==============
> .F
> Time: 0.01
> There was 1 failure:
> 1)
>
warning(junit.framework.TestSuite$1)junit.framework.AssertionFailedError:
> No tests found in AllTests
> at AllTests.main(AllTests.java:9)
>
> FAILURES!!!
> Tests run: 1, Failures: 1, Errors: 0
>
>
>
> The code:
> ========
> import junit.framework.*;
>
> public class AllTest extends TestCase {
>
> public static void main(String[] args) {
> junit.textui.TestRunner.run(new
> TestSuite(AllTest.class));
> }
>
> public static Test Suite() {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
>
> suite.addTest(new
> TestSuite(AccountJU.class));
> suite.addTest(new TestSuite(TestGame.class));
> return suite;
> }
>
> } // End of class
>
